data.name: Zoe Beta
data.description:
Zoe for Oculus Quest is a learning platform letting you design, visually program, and play your own interactive experiences all within your headset. Setting up your environment is easy: you can select from a variety of backgrounds, then drag and drop the models you want from the included 3D library. You can resize, rotate and place each model in your scene, and decide whether they are static or can be grabbed, are influenced by gravity...
Once you are set you can bring your environment to live using Zoe's interactive system. Program a full experience using an intuitive set of customizable conditions and actions. And of course, you can play it at any time. Have learning about how to create unique interactive experiences !

changelog.change_log:
"Cache system for downloaded models is fully working. 

Added information of number of models available for current account. 

Increased max. numbers of faces to 10k. 

Added warning for the user when too many requests are done to Sketchfab’s server. 

Error management for some faulty models has been improved.
Improved graphics performance, minor UI adjustments. Updated Terms&Conditions. Sketchfab still in Alpha stage

New Features:
- Beta access to Sketchfab library.

Improvements/fixes:
- Improved graphics.

Known Issues:
- There is a shader issue with the local library; sometimes assets show behind the Library panel.
- The Collision setting currently acts only partially on the colliders of an asset. It may happen that an object without collision activated still triggers collisions.
- Sketchfab: when the limit of downloads (50) has been reached the App loses all connection to Sketchfab (even changing accounts displays the same error).
- Sketchfab: the cache of downloaded assets does not always retrieve them properly if connection was lost during a session.
- Sketchfab: sometimes after adding a model from sketchfab, then closing the library, the model disappears. Usually the model is still in the memory but not visible, either go to Play and back to Edit, or kill the App and open it again; you should be able to see your model again. To avoid this, make sure you wait until the preview of the model has loaded AGAIN before selecting another asset or closing the library.

WARNING: Google Poly Library is not supported anymore.

New Features
New Local Library with higher resolution models and a few visual effects.
New In-App tutorials to onboard you, explaining the basic functions.
A low performance indicator shows up when the frame rate drops helping you optimize the assets in your scene.
Environments have been updated and three new ones are available.
New demo scenes are available.

Improvements/fixes
A placeholder shows when an asset is missing (if not available in the Library anymore) instead of having the scene not working.
Fixed Camera orientation difference between Play and Edit modes.
Fixed collision issue when going to Play Mode (this was causing collisions between objects inside others).

Known Issues
There is a shader issue with the local library; sometimes assets show behind the Library panel.
The Collision setting currently acts only partially on the colliders of an asset. It may happen that an object without collision activated still triggers collisions.
